summary.title: Kristian Kålund's Correspondence with Natanael Beckman and Others
summary.note: The letters of part I are arranged in alphabetic order by the correspondent's name; the letters of part II are in approximate reversed chronological order, with some exceptions.

supportDesc.foliation: Both parts are foliated in pencil; 1-174 and 175-566, respectively, by Agnete Loth. There is, however, no fol. 558 and it is uncertain whether it is a mistake in the foliation or somthing is missing.

history.origin: The letters are written in US, Norway, Sweden, England, Italy, Germany, Switzerland, France, Tunisia and Holland in the period 1883-1919.

provenance.p: Until 2019 the collection of Kålund's letters in Acc. 37 a, Acc. 37 b and Acc. 37 c was catalogued as Acc. 37 and this is how it appears in Agnete Loth's unpublished catalogue. The foliation in pencil is associated with Agnete Loth's cataloguing, but it is uncertain whether the division of the collection into five parts is also done by her.

recordHist.source: Catalogued in January 2019 by Katarzyna Anna Kapitan.

list.item: Backup film TS 1052 from , a copy of Neg. 844.

binding.p:
Acc. 37 b I consists of loose leaves which were put together into a pile. The pile is held together by a slip of yellow ruled paper, which has been glued together to make a sleeve. On the sleeve the text Breve til Kaalund
fra andre end Islendere. is written in black ink.

msItem.title: Notes

binding.p:
Acc. 37 b II consists of loose leaves which were put together into a pile. They are now held together by a slip of thick light brown plain paper, which has been glued together to make a sleeve. On the sleeve the text Kaalunds
Korrespondence
med
N. Beckman. is written in black ink.

Some of the leaves have clearly been rearranged, most likely at the time when the foliation was supplied, since some of the leaves bear impression marks of other leaves, which at present are not in their immediate proximity, e.g. fol. 506r.
